item.title: 芝加哥因市场波动推迟 6.43 亿美元债券交易
item.description: 在 4 万亿美元的州和地方债券市场波动之际，芝加哥推迟了原定于周三定价的 6.43 亿美元债券销售。【原文：Chicago is delaying its $643 million bond sale that was expected to price on Wednesday amid volatility in the $4 trillion market for state and local bonds.】

item.title: 戴蒙说他对通胀率能否回到美联储 2% 的目标持怀疑态度
item.description: 摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.首席执行官杰米-戴蒙（Jamie Dimon）表示，他对通胀率能否回到美联储2%的目标持怀疑态度，并列举了包括赤字支出和 "世界再军事化 "在内的风险。【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. Chief Executive Officer Jamie Dimon said he’s skeptical that inflation will return to the Federal Reserve’s 2% target, citing risks including deficit spending and “remilitarization of the world.”】

item.title: 加拿大央行担心就业前景可能推迟消费反弹
item.description: 加拿大央行官员越来越担心，疲软的就业市场可能会推迟消费支出的复苏，这种担忧促使他们在上个月下调了利率。【原文：Bank of Canada officials are increasingly worried that a weaker jobs market may delay a recovery in consumer spending, a concern that encouraged them to cut interest rates last month.】

item.title: 零息国债发行量在收益率下滑中创下新纪录
item.description: 由于预期美联储将于 9 月开始降息，国债市场创下今年最大涨幅，7 月份零息债券的发行量创下历史新高。【原文：A record amount of zero-coupon bonds were created in July as the Treasury market posted its biggest gain of the year in anticipation of Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts beginning in September.】

item.title: 8.76 亿美元外汇拍卖增加美元供应，奈拉上涨
item.description: 尼日利亚中央银行在一次罕见的货币拍卖中出售美元，以增加国内流动性，此后奈拉在官方市场上小幅走强。【原文：The naira strengthened slightly in the official market after the Central Bank of Nigeria sold dollars during a rare currency auction to boost domestic liquidity.】

item.title: 必和必拓为巴西金矿和铜矿寻找买家
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，全球第一大矿业公司必和必拓集团（BHP Group Ltd. ）正计划出售其在收购奥兹矿业公司（Oz Minerals Ltd. ）时获得的巴西铜金资产。【原文：BHP Group Ltd., the world’s No. 1 miner, is planning to sell Brazilian copper and gold assets it acquired with the takeover of Oz Minerals Ltd., according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 交易员为失业救济金申请后 S&P 500 指数的进一步波动做好准备
item.description: 受股市震荡影响的交易员们正准备迎接未来几个交易日的更多波动，首先是周四的美国申请失业救济人数报告。【原文：Traders whipsawed by the stock market’s gyrations are bracing for more bouts of volatility in the coming sessions, starting with Thursday’s report on US jobless claims.】

item.title: 高等级发行商在二月以来最繁忙的一天抢滩市场
item.description: 日本央行上周意外加息后，蓝筹股公司周三纷纷进入一级市场，以安抚市场。【原文：Blue-chip companies are clamoring into the primary market Wednesday after Bank of Japan moved to reassure markets following its unexpected rate hike last week.】

item.title: 微策略公司的赛勒称他个人拥有约 10 亿美元的比特币
item.description: 微策略公司（MicroStrategy Inc）的迈克尔-赛勒（Michael Saylor）在谈到比特币时直言不讳，称他个人已经积累了约 10 亿美元的加密货币。【原文：MicroStrategy Inc.’s Michael Saylor is putting his money were his mouth is when it comes to Bitcoin, saying he has personally accumulated around $1 billion of the cryptocurrency.】

item.title: 杰富瑞希望对公司创始人乔治-魏斯的付款进行审查
item.description: 杰富瑞金融集团（Jefferies Financial Group）希望对乔治-韦斯（George Weiss）在其同名投资公司韦斯多策略顾问公司（Weiss Multi-Strategy Advisers）今年早些时候申请破产前可能收到的任何款项进行独立审查。【原文：Jefferies Financial Group wants an independent review of any payments George Weiss may have received from his eponymous investment firm, Weiss Multi-Strategy Advisers, before it filed bankruptcy earlier this year.】

item.title: 塞族人抗议，美国和北约抨击科索沃重开重要桥梁的计划
item.description: 西方伙伴呼吁科索沃停止重新开放分隔阿族和塞族社区的一条河流上的一座重要桥梁的计划，因为这可能会重新点燃巴尔干国家北部的紧张局势。【原文：Western partners called on Kosovo to stop its plans to reopen a key bridge over a river separating Albanian and Serbian communities, which may rekindle tensions in the north of the Balkan country.】

item.title: 智利林业燃料巨头 Copec 探索绿色氢气和铜矿方案
item.description: 智利最大的工业集团 Empresas Copec SA 正在探索拓展绿色氢能和铜矿开采领域的方案，因为清洁能源转型会促进需求增长。【原文：Chile’s biggest industrial group Empresas Copec SA is exploring options to expand in green hydrogen and copper mining as the clean-energy transition boosts demand.】

item.title: 利比亚首席检察官下令逮捕石油部长
item.description: 利比亚总检察长下令逮捕该国的石油部长，但目前尚不清楚在这个欧佩克成员国长期的政治动荡中，谁目前担任着这个关键部门的职务。【原文：Libya’s prosecutor-general ordered the arrest of the country’s oil minister, though it was unclear who currently holds the post in the crucial ministry amid long-running political upheaval in the OPEC member nation.】

item.title: 英国监管机构要求在线服务 "立即行动 "制止骚乱
item.description: 英国电信监管机构敦促在线服务提供商采取行动，阻止客户利用其平台煽动暴力，尽管英国通信管理局（Ofcom）关于加强在线内容监管的新规定尚未生效。【原文：The UK telecommunications regulator urged online service providers to take action to stop customers from using their platforms to incite violence, even though Ofcom’s new rules with stronger requirements to police online content aren’t yet in effect.】

item.title: 银行家从佛罗里达州经济增长热潮中收获 150 亿美元小额贷款交易
item.description: 佛罗里达州向 "南方华尔街"（Wall Street South）的转变正在推动新移民的激增，对全州的基础设施造成了巨大的负担，并迫使市政当局以十多年来最快的速度进行借贷。【原文：Florida’s transformation into the Wall Street South is fueling a surge in newcomers, wearing on infrastructure across the state and forcing municipalities to borrow at the fastest pace in over a decade.】

item.title: 重组成为高风险借款人破产的中转站
item.description: 罗伯特肖（Robertshaw）是一家陷入困境的家电零部件制造商，去年，该公司达成了两笔颇具争议的融资交易，试图维持自身的运转。然后，今年它还是申请了破产。【原文：Robertshaw, a troubled appliance partmaker, cut two controversial financing deals last year to try to keep itself afloat. Then, this year, it filed for bankruptcy anyway.】

item.title: 加密货币市场的反弹将 Web3 和 Metaverse 代币抛在后面
item.description: 即使最近市场出现了一些波动，但对于数字代币交易者来说，加密货币寒冬已成为遥远的记忆。1 月份现货比特币交易所交易基金的推出，以及共和党总统候选人唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的支持，帮助他们从 FTX 倒闭引发的溃败中反弹。【原文：Even with recent market gyrations, the chill of crypto winter is becoming a distant memory for traders of digital tokens. The launch of spot Bitcoin exchange-traded funds in January and ringing endorsements from Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump have helped them bounce back from the rout sparked by the collapse of FTX.】

item.title: 欧洲天然气因乌克兰管道问题升至 2024 年高点
item.description: 据报道，乌克兰军队占领了关键的天然气过境点苏德扎，欧洲天然气价格飙升至今年最高水平。【原文：European gas prices soared to the highest level this year following a report that Ukrainian troops seized the key gas-transit point of Sudzha.】

item.title: 买方拥抱外包交易达到 10% 的 "临界点
item.description: 多年来，这一直是华尔街一个不为人知的秘密：一批基金经理正在将金融资产的买卖外包给纽约银行梅隆公司（Bank of New York Mellon Corp.【原文：It’s been a quiet secret on Wall Street for years now: A cohort of money managers are outsourcing the buying and selling of financial assets to the likes of Bank of New York Mellon Corp. in a bid to cut costs.】

item.title: 尽管中国出台新关税政策，智利炼钢业仍面临 "限产 "问题
item.description: 智利钢铁和铁矿石生产商 Cap SA 计划关闭其工厂，称对中国产品征收的新关税不足以确保南美国家炼钢业的盈利能力。【原文：Chilean steel and iron ore producer Cap SA plans to close its mills, saying new tariffs on Chinese products weren’t enough to ensure the profitability of steelmaking in the South American nation.】

item.title: 专家小组帮助世卫组织考虑非洲痘疹疫情是否属于紧急情况
item.description: 世界卫生组织将召集一个顾问小组，帮助确定在中非爆发的致命性天花疫情是否构成国际紧急状况。【原文：The World Health Organization will convene a panel of advisers to help determine whether a deadly outbreak of mpox in Central Africa constitutes an international emergency.】

item.title: 巴西雷亚尔疲软使 Azul 债券成为新兴市场最差债券之一
item.description: Azul SA 的债券是新兴市场公司债券中回报率最差的债券之一，因为巴西雷亚尔的暴跌加剧了人们对该航空公司财务状况的担忧。【原文：Azul SA’s bonds are delivering one of the worst returns in emerging-market corporate debt as a slumping Brazilian real boosts concerns about the airline’s finances.】

item.title: Aviva Investors 关闭唯一一家美国办事处，芝加哥再遭重创
item.description: Aviva Plc 的资产管理部门计划关闭其唯一的美国办事处，将重点放在英国本土以及加拿大的实际交易地点。【原文：Aviva Plc’s asset-management arm plans to close its only US office, focusing on its home country of the UK as well as Canada for physical trading locations.】

item.title: 中国恒大因欠款面临清盘申请
item.description: 中国恒大集团（Evergrande Group）旗下一家公司因未支付 2 亿元人民币（约合 2790 万美元）投资款及相关利息而成为清算申请的目标。【原文：A China Evergrande Group unit has become the target of a liquidation petition over an unpaid investment of 200 million yuan ($27.9 million) and related interest.】

item.title: 布雷万的主要对冲基金在两天的动荡中扭亏为盈
item.description: 本月的市场动荡帮助布雷万-霍华德资产管理公司（Brevan Howard Asset Management）的旗舰对冲基金扭转了此前的亏损局面，实现了全年盈利。【原文：This month’s market turmoil has helped Brevan Howard Asset Management’s flagship hedge fund swing to a profit for the year after reversing earlier losses.】

item.title: 纳米比亚称仅有 42% 获批采矿项目正在运营
item.description: 纳米比亚表示，该国批准的采矿项目中只有不到一半在运营，这促使政府在发放许可证时采取更强硬的立场。【原文：Namibia said less than half of the mining projects it has approved are in operation, prompting the government to take a tougher stance on issuing permits.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长雷恩认为近期市场波动反应过度
item.description: 欧洲中央银行管理委员会成员奥利-雷恩认为，近期全球股市的动荡是一种 "过度反应"。【原文：Recent turbulence in global stock markets was an “overreaction,” according to European Central Bank Governing Council member Olli Rehn.】

item.title: 波兰计划斥资数十亿兹罗提改造民防
item.description: 在俄罗斯入侵乌克兰之后，波兰正准备斥资数十亿兹罗提用于民防，因为这个欧盟国家正在加强其能力。【原文：Poland is preparing to spend billions of zloty on civil defense as the European Union nation ramps up its capabilities in the wake of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.】

item.title: 企业抢滩高等级市场，Meta 启动债券销售
item.description: Meta Platforms Inc. 是周三第一个进入美国投资级市场的公司，因为借款人希望利用一级市场的优势，而一级市场在周一的剧烈波动关闭了发行窗口后被大开。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. was the first to tap the US investment-grade market Wednesday, as borrowers look to take advantage of a primary market that was left wide open after Monday’s volatility slammed shut the issuance window.】

item.title: 埃塞俄比亚中央银行通过特别拍卖向银行出售美元
item.description: 埃塞俄比亚国家银行向商业贷款机构出售美元，以缩小官方汇率和平行汇率之间的差距。【原文：The National Bank of Ethiopia sold dollars to commercial lenders as it seeks to close the gap between official and parallel exchange rates.】
